question: Dr. Jones.
answer: Lao She.

question: Nee chin lie how ma?
answer: Wah hung how, nee nah? Wah hwey hung jing chee jah loo nee kao soo wah shu shu.

question: You never told me you spoke my language, Dr. Jones.
answer: I don't like to show off.

question: For this special occasion, I ordered champagne and caviar. So, it is true, Dr. Jones? you found Nurhachi?
answer: Sure, I found him. Then last night I had a little trouble. Somebody tried to slit my throat.

question: You have insulted my son.
answer: Next time I'll cut off more than his finger.

question: Dr. Jones -- I want Nurhachi.
answer: As I recall the deal was consid- erably more.

question: For crying out loud, a kid's driv- ing the car?!
answer: Relax, I've been giving him lessons.

question: Listen, we just met for crissake! I'm not that kind of gril!
answer: Don't get your hopes up -- where's the antidote?

question: You don't look very good.
answer: Poison never agrees with me. Pull a right, Short Round, and head for the Wang Poo bridge!

question: I'll take the extra ticket. Where's this plane going anyway?
answer: Siam.

question: Siam? But I'm not dressed for Siam...
answer: Thanks, Weber.

question: So, what're you supposed to be, a lion tamer?
answer: Since I was nice enough to let you tag along, why don't you give your mouth a rest? Okay, doll?

question: I'm freezing. What do you mean, tag along? From the minute you walked into that nightclub, you haven't been able to keep your eyes off me.
answer: Oh yeah?

question: Lao send planes to kill Indy!
answer: Wake up! It's the drug he drank to stop the poison -- You got to be kidding! No! No, I can't!

question: No, can't leave Indy!
answer: Give me that parachute, I changed my mind --

question: Okay, Shorty.
answer: No... I'm not cut out for the kind of life you lead. Oh no...I ripped my dress. Where are we anyway?

question: India...
answer: Holy cow -- India? How do you know we're in -- What'd he say?

question: He told me they knew I was coming here.
answer: What do you mean -- how?

question: The old man saw it in a dream.
answer: Dream -- nightmare is more like it.

question: He said that's whey they were at river -- they were waiting for the plane to fall down.
answer: I hope this means we're going to get some dinner. God, I am starving, but I can't eat this...

question: That's more food than these people eat in a week. They're starving, too...
answer: I'm sorry, I -- here, please.

question: I'm a professor. I have to re- turn to the university. Can you give us a guide to take us to Delhi? Thank you.
answer: On the way to Delhi, you will stop at Pankot.

question: Pankot isn't on the way to Delhi.
answer: You will go to palace there.

question: Hasn't the Pankot palace been de- serted since the Mutiny of 1857?
answer: No. Now there is new Maharajah -- and palace is powerful again.

question: I don't understand. What's hap- pened here?
answer: The evil starts in Pankot. Then like monsoon, it moves darkness over all country.

question: What evil?
answer: They came from Palace and took sivalinga from out village.

question: Oh boy!
answer: This is the first time anybody ever cried when I left.

question: They don't cry about you. They cry about the elephants leaving.
answer: Figures...

question: Those are very big bird.
answer: Those aren't birds -- those are giant bats.

question: They must be pretty dumb to drink that awful-looking water.
answer: I think maybe we'll camp here. Hey, Willie -- I think you better get out now.

question: Stark naked? You wish... If you're trying to seduce me, Dr. Jones, this is a very primitive approach.
answer: Me seduce you? Honey, you're the one who took your clothes off. I just came over to remind you that you never know what else might be in the water.

question: Somehow I feel safer in here. Indy! Help me!
answer: Don't worry, I'm coming in! What is it?

question: A snake!
answer: A what...?

question: A SNAKE!!
answer: Uh, listen -- Willie -- I got a better idea.

question: What?!
answer: First of all -- don't panic!

question: It's got me ! Indy, help me!
answer: Don't let it pull you deeper!

question: It's pulling me deeper!
answer: Don't let it curl around you!

question: It's curling around me! Damn it, stop talking and do something!
answer: Listen, Willie. Do exactly what I tell you now.

question: What?!
answer: Can you move your arm?

question: Just one arm!
answer: Okay, I want you to lift your hand -- and pet the snake.

question: PET IT??!!
answer: Yes, stroke it right along the maxillary and precaudal verte- brae.

question: THE WHAT?!
answer: Pet it on the head! Go on, pet it!

question: Oh -- my -- god -- it's going to crush me!
answer: Keep stroking it!

question: It's starting to let go!
answer: That's good -- you're doing fine.

question: It's letting fo. I think it's -- I think it's going to sleep!
answer: See -- I got you out...

question: Thanks for nothing! I hate snakes!
answer: I know the feeling...

question: Where'd you find your little body- guard?
answer: I met Short Round when he tried to pick my pocket.

question: He'll be okay. He's a good kid.
answer: By the way, how'd you end up in Shanghai?

question: Well, when my nightclub career was run over by the Depression, some pinhead convinced me that "a girl could go places in the Orient..." So, look where I got.
answer: What about the future?

question: Oh, that's easy -- I'm going to latch onto a good-looking, in- credibly rich prince.
answer: I'd like to find one of those myself.

question: Oh really?
answer: Yeah, but he's got to be dead and buried for a couple of thousand years. Fortune and glory...

question: Is that what you're hoping to find at this palace, Dr. Jones?
answer: Maybe...

question: What's that?
answer: Something that kid gave me last night. It's a piece of an old manuscript.

question: What does the writing say?
answer: It's Sanskrit. It tells the story of Sankara climbing Mt. Kalisa where he met the Hindu god Shiva.

question: That's Shiva? What's he giving the Priest?
answer: Legend says he told Sankara to go forth and combat evil. To do that he gave him five sacred stones that had magical powers.

question: You mean magical like the rock that was stolen from that village?
answer: It could be.

question: Fortune and glory...sweet dreams, Dr. Jones.
answer: I think you should sleep closer. I meant for safety.

question: I'd be safer sleeping with that snake. Did you see it?! It was one of those bats! God, what else is out there...?!
answer: Couldn't keep away, huh?

question: Just try and control yourself.
answer: Still scared? Okay, Willie, you can get closer if you want... Honey, I knew you'd be the first one to give in...

question: Just a statue.
answer: What's the guide talking about? He hasn't said a word the whole trip. He's afraid of something.

question: He said he couldn't take us any farther. He has to go sell the elephants.
answer: You mean we have to walk the rest of the way? -- shot at, fallen out of a plane, nearly drowned, squashed by a snake, attacked by a bat -- I smell like an elephant! I tell you I'm not going to make it!

question: Any more complaints?
answer: Yeah, I wish you'd thought of this sooner...

question: It doesn't feel like there's been any permanent damage. Hello?... ...
Dr. Jones? The eminent archae- ologist?
answer: Hard to believe, isn't it...?

question: I remember first hearing your name when I was studying at Oxford. I Am Chattar Lal, Prime Minister for His Highness the Maharajah of Pankot.
answer: How'd you like to run into him in a dark alley...that one's kind of cute...I could see myself married to a prince like that...

question: The plane crash and your journey here sound -- most incredible.
answer: You should have been there...

question: I am only his humble servant, but the Maharajah usually listens to my advice.
answer: Is that him?

question: No, no, that is Uhmed Singh, the present Maharajah's late father.
answer: Oh -- good. And maybe the pres- ent Marahajah is a little younger? And thinner?

question: They will escort you to your rooms now. You will be provided with fresh clothes. Tonight you will be dining with His Highness.
answer: Dinner? And with a prince?! My luck is changing. But look at me -- my god, I've to to get ready!

question: Interested in local curios?
answer: No. But I am interested in the occult. And this is a krtya.

question: Charming.
answer: It's like the voodoo dolls of West Africa. The kryta represents your enemy -- and gives you complete power over him.

question: That God all that mumbo jumbo rubbish is disappearing.
answer: You think so?

question: Of course. Admittedly, it's taken time. Britian's controlled India for almost two hundred eyars now.
answer: You're hanging on better here than you did in America.

question: This is a different situation, Dr. Jones. These people are like children. We have to lead them slowly into the twentieth century.
answer: The Prime Minister doesn't seem that naive.

question: I suppose stories of the Thuggees die hard.
answer: There are no stories anymore.

question: Well, I don't know... we came here from a small village and the peas- ants there told us that the Pankot Palace was growing powerful again -- becuase of some ancient evil.
answer: Their stories are just fear and folklore.

question: Maybe.. but how do you explain The Thuggee shrine I saw right below the palace?
answer: The local peasants are just as superstitious. You're very ob- servant, Dr. Jones. But you're beginning to worry Capt. Blum- burtt.

question: I was dubious muself at first. Then something connected -- the village's rock and the old legend of the Sankara Stones...
answer: Dr. Jones, we are all vulnerable to vicious rumors. I seem to re- member that in Honduras you were accused of being a grave robber rather than a scientist.

question: The newspapers exaggerated the incident
answer: And didn't the Sultan of Madagas- car threaten to cut your head off if you ever returned to his coun- try?

question: That was a misunderstanding.
answer: Exactly what we have here, Dr. Jones.

question: We're guests here, Shorty.
answer: You will show me how it works please.

question: You wish is my command, your Highness.
answer: That is wonderful! Please teach me how!

question: Okay, Short Round, let go of it.
answer: That little Maharajah think he big stuff.

question: You don't like him do you?
answer: Next time I flatten him! Did you see his eyes?

question: No.
answer: Indy, they glow like fire and get real crazy! Then he talk in this real scary voice!

question: He was afraid of you. He knows a tough guy when he sees one.
answer: Yeah, that's what happened...

question: I better see how Willie is. I brought you something.
answer: Not leftovers?

question: No -- real food.
answer: Oh, it is real food...it's beautiful.

question: Wearing your jewels to be, prin- cess?
answer: Yeah -- and nothing else. That shock you?

question: I'm a scientist. I like doing research on certain "nocturnal activities" --
answer: You mean like love rituals...

question: And mating customs...
answer: Primitive sexual practices?

question: You're taling to an authority in that area.
answer: You're dying to come into my room, aren't you?

question: You want me so bad, why don't you invite me?
answer: Too proud to admit you're crazy about me, Dr. Jones?

question: I think you're too used to get- ting you own way, Willie...
answer: We'll see who gives in first -- I'll leave my door open.

question: Don't catch cold.
answer: Dr. Jones -- ?

question: You're dreaming, Willie. You want to make it real, just knock on my door. Five minutes... fat chance.
answer: Five minutes, Dr. Jones...

question: It's okay, it's over -- go turn off the fan. This a cheap trick to get me over here?
answer: No -- don't you see -- crawling --

question: What -- the bug?
answer: Get -- the -- bug -- off!

question: Lock your door and don't leave until we get back.
answer: I don't think we suppose to be in here, Indy...

question: You're right, there's something all over the floor...
answer: Indy, the floor -- there is some- thing alive! Holy smoke -- I'm scared, Indy!

question: Willie, damn it! Get down here,
answer: Oh hell -- I bet I get all dirty again!

question: WILLIE?!
answer: I'm coming, what's the rush?! Ohh! What's that?! There's stuff all over the floor! I can't see a thing!

question: Move, Willie! Faster!
answer: It's all wet and icky! Aaahh -- things are moving!!

question: There's bugs! Bugs all over! Help! Help me!
answer: Willie, open the door! GET US OUT OF HERE!

question: OPEN THE DOOR! LET ME IN!!
answer: GET US OUT! Willie, shut up and listen! There's got to be a ful- crum release! Look around!

question: A what?!
answer: A fulcrum release lever!

question: I can't find any lever! Help me Indy!
answer: Look around, Willie! There's got to be a liever hidden somewhere! Come on, you can do it!

question: There's a hole! I found a square hole!
answer: That's it -- the release lever -- look inside!

question: I am -- it looks horrible!
answer: Reach inside!

question: I can't, Indy! I can't!
answer: The lever! Willie, do it! NOW!

question: Oh God, it's soft -- it's moving!
answer: Willie!

question: Get is off me -- get it off!
answer: Not that one! We had enought of that one, thank you...

question: What is it...?
answer: It's a Thuggee ceremony. They're whorshipping Kali, the goddess of Death and Destruction.

question: Oh my God! He ripped out his -- he killed him!
answer: No...the heart's still beating!

question: Let's go! Let's get out of here!
answer: Quiet! The village knew their rock was magic -- but they didn't know it was one of the lost Sankara Stones...

question: Legend says that when the stones are brought together the diamonds inside of them will glow.
answer: Diamonds...?

question: Okay -- now listen -- you wait here and keep quiet. Shorty, keep an eye on her.
answer: Wait -- what're you doing?

question: I'm going down.
answer: Down? Down there?! Are you crazy --!

question: I'm not leaving without those stones.
answer: You're gonna get killed chasing after your damn fortune and glory!

question: What is that?
answer: You were caught trying to steal the Sankara Stones.

question: Nobody's perfect. The way I heard it, you stole one of them from a small village.
answer: There were five stones in the beginning. Over the centuries they were dispersed by wars, sold off by thieves like you...

question: Two are still missing.
answer: No. They are here -- somewhere. A century ago when the British raided this temple and butchered my people, a loyal priest his the last two stones down here in the catacombs.

question: That's what you've got these chil- dren -- these slaves digging for?
answer: They dig for the gems to support our cause. They also search for the last two stones. Soon we will have all five Sankara Stones and the Thuggees will be all powerful!

question: Nobody can say you don't have a vivid imagination.
answer: You do not believe me? You will, Dr. Jones. You will become a true believer.

question: You do not believe me? You will, Dr. Jones. You will become a true believer.
answer: You will not suffer. I recently became of age and tasted the blood of Kali.

question: Hold him!
answer: You will learn to obey because you are powerless!

question: Oh my God, you scared me! Listen, you've got to help. We found this tunnel --
answer: Jones isn't in his room. Miss Scott -- my troops are leaving at dawn if you want us to escort you to Delhi --

question: No -- you can't go! Something aw- ful's happened. They've got Short Round and I think Indy's been --
answer: What?

question: What're you talking about -- I'm not a dope fiend! I saw it! I'll show you!
answer: What're we playing, hid and seek?

question: Oh, Indy, you got away! Tell them what happened, they won't believe me --
answer: It's okay. You're all right now.

question: They think I'm insane. Tell them I'm not, Indy. Please -- help me ...
answer: Hey, I thought you were supposed to be a real tropper. Willie?

question: What?
answer: You've got to go to sleep now.

question: I want to go home...
answer: I don't blame you... this hasn't been what you'd call a fun vaca- tion... I've spent by life crawling around in caves and tunnels -- I shouldn't have let somebody like Willie go in there with me.

question: Thanks, but I don't think Willie is ready to travel yet.
answer: Indy? Did you walk to them?

question: Yes.
answer: So now they believe me.

question: Yes, they believe you.
answer: Then they'll send the soldiers down into the temple...

question: No... they won't kill me.
answer: You know you've been nothing but trouble since I hooked up with you -- but I have to admit I'd miss you if I lost you...

question: Look out -- !
answer: Come on, quick!

question: What're we going to do?
answer: We're going to get them out of here -- ! Ah, sir? Excuse me -- No, wait!

question: What're we going to do?!
answer: There's got to be another way out. Those empty cars have got to go out of the mines.

question: I can't!
answer: Go! We've got to get across to the empty cars. Wait here until I signal you. Come on!

question: No, Indy, it's left tunnel.
answer: Come here and take the brake!

question: Read you loud and clear, Indy!
answer: Let up on the brake!

question: What?!
answer: Let her go! Our only chance is outrunning them!

question: Grab onto me -- I'm going to try and slow us down from underneath!
answer: Oh no!

question: What's wrong? Ouch...
answer: I'm okay -- I'm fine -- I love to flirt with death... What's that?...Indy?! Oh... shit...

question: There! Dive! Lucky I found a short cut. Look, there's a light at the end of the tunnel...
answer: Some short cut!

question: Let my friends go!
answer: You are in no position to give orders, Dr. Jones.

question: You want the stones, let them go and call off your guards!
answer: Impressive, Dr. Jones. But I don't believe you would kill yourself!

question: Then I guess we're all going to take a big dive!
answer: Give me the stones!
